verses.verse: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David; to bring to remembrance. Make haste, O God<WH430>, to deliver<WH5337> me<WH2363>; Make haste to help<WH5833> me<WH3068>, O Jehovah.

Let them be put to shame<WH954> and confounded<WH954> That seek<WH1245> after my soul<WH5315>: Let them be turned<WH5472> backward<WH268> and brought to dishonor<WH3637> That delight<WH2655> in my hurt<WH7451>.
Let them be turned back<WH7725> by reason<WH6118> of their shame<WH1322> That say<WH559>, Aha<WH1889>, aha<WH1889>.

Let all those that seek<WH1245> thee rejoice<WH7797> and be glad<WH8055> in thee<WH157>; And let such as love thy salvation<WH3444> say<WH559> continually<WH8548>, Let God<WH430> be magnified<WH1431>.
But I am poor<WH6041> and needy<WH34>; Make haste<WH2363> unto me<WH430>, O God: Thou art my help<WH5828> and my deliverer<WH6403>; O Jehovah<WH3068>, make no tarrying<WH309>.
